Package main

Class Scoreboard

java.lang.Object
main.Scoreboard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Scoreboard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
The Scoreboard class is used to store the top 5 scores achieved in the game. This class is serializable and is saved/loaded from file when the scores are updated, or the game starts. These scores are displayed on the game over screen, and allows you to see how your score compares to others.
Author:
Harry Felton
See Also:
DeathFragment, Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • save

      public void save()
      Save this instance of Scoreboard to the file specified in SCOREBOARD_PATH

    • addNewScore

      public void addNewScore​(int score)
      Adds a new score to the scores list, resorts it with the highest scores at the top, and then trims any scores that are below the top 5.
      Parameters:
      score - The score to add

    • getTopScores

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getTopScores()
      Returns the list of the top scores
      Returns:
      The list of scores

    • getTopScoreLimit

      public int getTopScoreLimit()
      Returns the amount of scores this scoreboard is capable of holding
      Returns:
      The limit of top scores

    • loadScoreboard

      public static Scoreboard loadScoreboard()
      Loads the scoreboard instance from the file SCOREBOARD_PATH and returns it. If loading fails (e.g. file does not exist), a new scoreboard instance is returned for use instead.
      Returns:
      A loaded scoreboard, or a new one if loading fails

    • saveScoreboard

      public static void saveScoreboard​(Scoreboard scoreboard)
      Saves this scoreboard to the file SCOREBOARD_PATH
      Parameters:
      scoreboard - The scoreboard to save
